channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 情報筋：NBAは、ディズニーとアマゾンからそれぞれ年間26億ドルと18億ドルを含む、11年間で760億ドルをリーグに支払う契約締結に近づいている（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Sources: the NBA is close to signing deals that would pay the league ~$76B over 11 years, including $2.6B and $1.8B a year from Disney and Amazon, respectively  —  The National Basketball Association is close to signing new long-term broadcasting agreements that would pay the league …

item.title: ガネット、第1四半期の売上高は前年同期比5%減の$635.8M、デジタル収入は8.1%増の$267.5M、~$46Mの減損費用を含む$84.8Mの純損失、GCIは27%増で終了 (Gannett)
item.description:
Gannett:
Gannett reports Q1 revenue down 5% YoY to $635.8M, digital revenue up 8.1% to $267.5M, an $84.8M net loss including a ~$46M impairment charge; GCI closes up 27%  —  Gannett Co., Inc. ("Gannett", “we”, “us”, “our”, or the “Company") (NYSE: GCI) today reported its financial results for the first quarter ended March 31, 2024.

item.title: ネットフリックスに対抗するインドネシアのストリーミング配信会社ヴィディオは、IPOに向け、今後2〜3年で有料会員数を2倍の800万人に増やすことを目指している（Sohee Kim/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Sohee Kim / Bloomberg:
Indonesia's Vidio, a local streaming competitor to Netflix, aims to double its paid subscribers to 8M in the next two to three years ahead of an IPO  —  - Youthful population of over 270 million a draw for streamers  — Low 5G penetration remains an obstacle to increasing customers

item.title: アップル第2四半期：Apple TV+とApple Musicを含むサービス部門の売上は前年同期比14%増の239億ドル、予想232.7億ドルに対し過去最高（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Apple Q2: revenue from Services, which includes Apple TV+ and Apple Music, rose 14% YoY to $23.9B, vs. $23.27B estimated, an all-time record  —  The Apple Services segment generated $23.87 billion, up 14.2%, for the quarter ended March 30, topping analyst forecasts of $23.12 billion.

item.title: ダナ・バッシュが5月1日にCNNで行った親パレスチナ派学生の抗議デモについてのモノローグには、嘘、他人のスピンの焼き直し、親イスラエル・プロパガンダの繰り返しが含まれていた（Jack Mirkinson/Discourse Blog）
item.description:
Jack Mirkinson / Discourse Blog:
Dana Bash's May 1 CNN monologue about pro-Palestinian student protests included lies, regurgitated others' spin, and repeated lines of pro-Israel propaganda  —  I have covered the U.S. media for a long time.  I have watched more hours of cable news than is healthy for any human being.

item.title: ニュースルームの調査に基づいて取引を行うヘッジファンド、ハンターブルックと、コネクションのある創設者サム・コッペルマンとナサニエル・ホーウィッツについて（クレア・マローン／ニューヨーカー誌）
item.description:
Clare Malone / New Yorker:
A look at Hunterbrook, whose hedge fund makes trades based on investigations by its newsroom, and well-connected founders Sam Koppelman and Nathaniel Horwitz  —  The hybrid media-finance company wants to monetize investigative journalism in the public interest.  Is it a visionary game changer or a cynical ploy?

item.title: 情報筋ソニー・ピクチャーズとアポロ・グローバルがパラマウントの買収に正式に関心を表明、スカイダンスとの交渉期間は5月3日まで（New York Times）
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Sony Pictures and Apollo Global formally express interest in acquiring Paramount for ~$26B; Paramount's negotiating period with Skydance ends May 3  —  Paramount has been exploring a potential deal for months, talking to suitors including Skydance, producer of “Top Gun: Maverick.”

item.title: Fubo、DirecTVなどが書簡で、Fox、Disney、WBDのスポーツ・ストリーマーに関する公聴会の開催を議会に要請。"深刻な競争上の懸念 "を理由に（Etan Vlessing/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Etan Vlessing / The Hollywood Reporter:
In a letter, Fubo, DirecTV, and others call on Congress to hold hearings on the Fox, Disney, and WBD's sports streamer, citing “serious competition concerns”  —  DirecTV, Dish Network and Newsmax also joined the call for hearings in Washington, D.C. into the future of pay TV competition and its impact on consumers.

item.title: ジョアンナ・コールズがデイリービーストのチーフ・クリエイティブ・コンテンツ・オフィサーに就任。
item.description:
Justin Miller / New York Magazine:
A look at Joanna Coles' start as the Daily Beast's chief creative and content officer, where her vision is at odds with the outlet's hard-news scoop approach  —  On her first week on the job as chief creative and content officer, Joanna Coles carried a tip into the newsroom …

item.title: ニールセン、SAG-AFTRAのストリーミング・コンテンツ計測のサード・パーティ・プロバイダーとなる契約を締結、組合がストリーミング配信者からの視聴率データを相互チェックできるようにする（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Nielsen signs a deal to be SAG-AFTRA's third-party provider of streaming content measurement, to help the union cross-check viewership data from streamers  —  The data will “complement first-party data from streaming platforms.” … The Nielsen data — from its Streaming Content Ratings service …

item.title: WSJのエマ・タッカーEICによると、同紙は「（アジアの）重心を香港からシンガポールに移し」、「一部の」スタッフをレイオフするという（Lucia Moses/@lmoses）
item.description:
Lucia Moses / @lmoses:
WSJ EIC Emma Tucker says the paper is “shifting our center of gravity [in Asia] from Hong Kong to Singapore”, leading to layoffs of “some” staff  —  More changes at @wsj since I wrote this, with restructuring and layoffs in Asia [image]

item.title: ニュースを集約したニュースレターを毎日発行し、購読者350万人、スタッフ15人、年商1500万ドルのメディアブランド1440を見てみよう（Jim Edwards/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Jim Edwards / Press Gazette:
A look at 1440, a media brand with a single daily newsletter that aggregates news and has 3.5M subscribers, 15 staff, and ~$15M in annual revenue  —  1440 may be the biggest media brand you've never heard of.  It has an email subscriber list of 3.5 million, and it is growing at a rate …

item.title: サムスンTVプラスがMLB、PGAツアー、F1、ONEチャンピオンシップと提携、新しいファミリー、ニュース、音楽番組を発表、ワーナーミュージックと契約（Dade Hayes/Deadline）
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Samsung TV Plus partners with the MLB, PGA Tour, F1, and ONE Championship, announces new family, news, and music programming, and signs a Warner Music deal  —  Samsung TV Plus, the free FAST platform operated by the leading smart-TV maker, is breaking ground in the sports arena as part of a broader programming push.

item.title: ソーシャルメディア・プラットフォームがニュース配信から軸足を移すなか、アグリゲーションなど、よりソーシャルメディアのように感じられるThe Vergeのようなニュースサイトを見てみよう（Kyle Chayka/New Yorker）
item.description:
Kyle Chayka / New Yorker:
As social media platforms pivot away from news distribution, a look at news sites like The Verge, which feel more like social media, with aggregation and more  —  As social networks become less reliable distributors of the news, consumers of digital journalism are seeking out an older form of online real estate.

item.title: ユニバーサル・ミュージック・グループとTikTokが新たな音楽ライセンス契約を締結、UMGの楽曲を同プラットフォームに復活、「報酬の改善」とAI保護を含む（Jem Aswad/Variety）
item.description:
Jem Aswad / Variety:
Universal Music Group and TikTok strike a new music licensing deal to bring UMG music back to the platform, including “improved remuneration” and AI protections  —  The months-long standoff between Universal Music Group and TikTok over royalty payments and AI policies is finally over …
